featured.text: After the Second World War, a great number of American soldiers were stationed in Europe.
Swiss generals decided to issue each soldier a standard knife to serve both as a screwdriver and a can opener.
A few years after the soldier’s knife was issued, the “Schweizer Offizier Messer,” or Swiss Officer’s Knife, came on the market.
In the 1950s, flip-flops became popular in the United States as soldiers returning from occupied Japan brought zōris home.
Even fewer people know that Dumas’ father rose rapidly from a soldier to a general in the French Army before he was 31.

other.text: The Swiss army needed a knife for every soldier.
The knife was sold out to American soldiers.
In the late nineteenth century, the Swiss army issued its soldiers a gun that required a special screwdriver to dismantle and clean it.
The soldier was put on trial for to obey his commanding officer’s order.
In 1884, Carl Elsener, head of the Swiss knife manufacturer Victorinox, seized that opportunity with both hands, and designed a soldier’s knife that the army loved.
The sandals American soldiers brought home from Japan later became modern flip-flops.

definition.zh_def: 士兵，軍隊中的成員，負責執行戰鬥任務或保護國家。
definition.en_def: A person who serves in an army, especially a member of the infantry.
definition.example: The soldier bravely defended his country during the war.
